data.text: I tried a butterfly bar. I had one that was 780mm wide(very wide). It seemed unstable when loaded (20 kg. (44 pounds)). I have a Moloko bar and a Jones Loop bar. I have settled on the jones because it felt more upright and more stable to me. The Jones does lack a positiono to be forward into the wind. I think I can add some bar ends ont he front though. I choose bars based on 1) control (safety), then only after I feel I can control a fully loaded bike, do I look for comfort. Hope my 2 cents helps.
data.author: Andrew Hill

data.text: I can't be incredibly helpful, but I recently put a 580mm butterfly bar on my bike, replacing a flat bar. I also went from a 90mm stem to a 70mm stem. Thus far, it seems a drastic improvement! I've ridden about 90 miles, more or less, with this combination. It is much more comfortable, adds a lot of hand options, and my legs feel better after a ride. Again, this is very short term use, but thus far, I'm sold.
data.author: Terry L. Manuel
